verses.name: Job 16:1
verses.text: Then Job answered and said,

verses.name: Job 16:2
verses.text: I have heard many such things: miserable comforters are ye all.

verses.name: Job 16:3
verses.text: Shall vain words have an end? or what emboldeneth thee that thou answerest?

verses.name: Job 16:4
verses.text: I also could speak as ye do: if your soul were in my soul’s stead, I could heap up words against you, and shake mine head at you.

verses.name: Job 16:5
verses.text: But I would strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips should asswage your grief.

verses.name: Job 16:6
verses.text: Though I speak, my grief is not asswaged: and though I forbear, what am I eased?

verses.name: Job 16:7
verses.text: But now he hath made me weary: thou hast made desolate all my company.

verses.name: Job 16:8
verses.text: And thou hast filled me with wrinkles, which is a witness against me: and my leanness rising up in me beareth witness to my face.

verses.name: Job 16:9
verses.text: He teareth me in his wrath, who hateth me: he gnasheth upon me with his teeth; mine enemy sharpeneth his eyes upon me.

verses.name: Job 16:10
verses.text: They have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.

verses.name: Job 16:11
verses.text: God hath delivered me to the ungodly, and turned me over into the hands of the wicked.

verses.name: Job 16:12
verses.text: I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder: he hath also taken me by my neck, and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.

verses.name: Job 16:13
verses.text: His archers compass me round about, he cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.

verses.name: Job 16:14
verses.text: He breaketh me with breach upon breach, he runneth upon me like a giant.

verses.name: Job 16:15
verses.text: I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, and defiled my horn in the dust.

verses.name: Job 16:16
verses.text: My face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death;

verses.name: Job 16:17
verses.text: Not for any injustice in mine hands: also my prayer is pure.

verses.name: Job 16:18
verses.text: O earth, cover not thou my blood, and let my cry have no place.

verses.name: Job 16:19
verses.text: Also now, behold, my witness is in heaven, and my record is on high.

verses.name: Job 16:20
verses.text: My friends scorn me: but mine eye poureth out tears unto God.

verses.name: Job 16:21
verses.text: O that one might plead for a man with God, as a man pleadeth for his neighbour!

verses.name: Job 16:22
verses.text: When a few years are come, then I shall go the way whence I shall not return.
